data.title: not a italian restaurant
data.text: visited this located for the first time this past weekend since we were in the neighborhood and so wish we hadn't chosen this one.  we ordered something that is pretty customary at an Italian restaurant pasta with vodka sauce and added chicken; my daughter ordered a slice of pizza.  I went to the ladies room to wash my hands before eating our meal.  upon walking in the restroom, the smell almost knocked me down. I don't know whether there was a dead rat or ruined chicken that was contributing to the smell, but it was absolutely horrible; the smell is similar.  that was the start of the bad experience.  we got our meal and the dish tasted really bad, almost like ruined chicken, so we were unable to eat the meal.  the waitress asked us if everything was wonderful and I had to tell her, my husband and I weren't please with the meal.  we only ate a couple of bites each and decided we couldn't stomach any more.  I told her we knew it wasn't her fault.  she did not get the owner/manager to come speak with us and acted offended that we had the nerve to complain.  we couldn't believe they didn't want to please their customer by at least offering to let us have another dish or give a discount.  needless to say, we won't be going back and we won't visit the sister location on Galloway ever again either.

data.title: Great italian at a great price
data.text: We love this italian restaurant. Food is always great, love the garlic rolls. Service is always fast and efficient. Chicken parmesan is my go-to dish at any italian restaurant and Joe's is one of my favorites.

data.title: My family has been coming here for years
data.text:
My family has been coming here almost since it first opened. 

The pizza is awesome, but my personal favorite has always been their house vinagarette dressing. My usual order is two pieces of pizza and a side of the dressing to dunk them in. 

There is not much seating inside, so if it is even slightly busy you may be stuck waiting for a table.

data.title: good pizza
data.text: we were very surprised that the pizza was soo good.  We went in and got it to go and they were fast and efficient, the pizza was really good.

data.title: Average
data.text: Another average restaurant.  Not bad but not impressive.  The staff was cool and the prices were ok.  Worth trying.

data.title: Italian pizza and choice of pastas etc.
data.text: Excellent service, with great food.  Large servings, along with a salad.  The food comes in generous servings, along with great bread.  The food is served very quickly by very helpful and friendly servers.

data.title: Pizza is Great
data.text: Love the Pizza!! The Cheese is Fantastic!! Did not like the other dishes. Have been a few times. It's a good place.

data.title: Wow! I Never Saw You!
data.text: Excellent lunch menu with unbeatable prices!  I had the lasagna lunch.  The salad was perfect and the portion size of the lasagna was a little too large for me, but that is much better than too small!  The price was less than $8, but more than $5 a person.  A great lunch stop!

data.title: Hmmmm...best pizza in Mesquite....could be....
data.text:
Hey...another one of the places in Mesquite that I keep hearing friends talk about...and one of those places that I'm always forgetting about....last night, finally had some of their pizza.  While it isn't as good as Chicago's Original was, it's still a fine pizza.   Much better than 98% of the options here in Mesquite.  

I don't usually care for a plain cheese pizza, but the one we had from Joe's was fantastic.  Try it, you shouldn't be disappointed, unless you are one of those that think CiCi's is a fine pizza experience.

Oh, and if you are looking for the bathrooms, since it's in one of those really old Taco Bell's...they should be OUTSIDE around back....

data.title: Good Italian
data.text: This is a family type Italian pizza-type restraunt that also serves decent Italian food.  It's a good value, family owned and conveniently located.  Reminds me of Lady and the Tramp with the spagetti and decor.

data.title: Offbeat little Italian Place
data.text: This is a little neighborhood Pizza and Pasta place in a building that has housed a Chinese restaurant and a deli previously.  You can tell it started out as a Chinese restaurant first because that's what it was built for and the roofline looks like one of those old temples with the upturned corners.  When Joe's moved in, we thought, well, this won't last either... Anyway we gave it a try and have been pleasantly surprised.  We eat here every couple of weeks.  We've become regular enough that we order things that aren't on the regular menu, for instance, the mushroom tortellini which is a sometimes special, is excellent and not on the regular menu and you can order it anytime.  They have wonderful bread. The salad is extremely skimpy.  They count the lettuce leaves and you will only get a half a thin tomato slice (I've watched them assemble the salad, so I'm not kidding here), but the salad dressings are very tasty.  Everything is really, really reasonably priced.  So, skimpy salad aside, we love this place!  You'll eat for about $8.00 a person (or less) if you don't order an appetizer.

data.title: The closest to NY pizza I have had in TX.
data.text: Joes in Mesquite on Galloway has the best pizza in TX. I have had pie in NY and Joes comes real close to matching the taste. Joes is consistent in service,price and flavor. I can always count that my food (dine in or carryout) will be great! The staff has been the same for years and are alwayd ready to take care of you! **** four stars!!

data.title: Joe's is my favorite Italian food restaurant.  I prefer it over Spaghetti Warehouse!  Their food is  always fresh, hot...
data.text:
Joe's is my favorite Italian food restaurant.  I prefer it over Spaghetti Warehouse!  Their food is  always fresh, hot, and brought to your table as it is prepared and as you are ready for it.

The pizza is hand tossed, and only the freshest ingredients are used.  The large pizza is twice the size of any chain pizza restaurant's.

My favorite dish is the Eggplant Parmesan, which I get almost every time I visit.

I would recommend Joe's to anyone.  Do not let the old Taco Bell building turn you off.  It is a cozy little place that you will absolutely adore!
